tagline: Designs API contracts that developers integrate with correctly on the first try
pros: Contract-first design with thorough OpenAPI/protobuf specifications
Obsessive consistency in naming, errors, and pagination across endpoints
Strong API evolution and versioning strategies that protect consumers
Developer experience focus — documentation that actually reduces support burden
cons: Perfectionism about HTTP semantics can feel pedantic to pragmatic teams
Contract-first approach adds upfront time before implementation starts
Less effective when the API is purely internal with a single consumer
